title: Please help!
content:
I am working on designing a portfolio site for a local artist.. working on creating a very simple logo lockup for her site as well..She’s a painter, wants something neat and simple.. this is what I have come up with so far.. please tear it apart/give me advice with where to turn.. thanks!!

p.s. this is my first time posting..

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 6.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20090515134650/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%206_26.png) | 24.81 KB |
author: brinnsand

comments.content:
well they’re fairly neat and simple. but it doesn’t really do much.  
I think your overworking it in all the examples posted.  
Using well chosen and set type is not a crime - read: you don’t need to add bits and pieces like joining the I and the H etc (it doesn’t add anything).

—————  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Designer](http://web.archive.org/web/20090515134650/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)  
 [Short Film Festival](http://web.archive.org/web/20090515134650/http:/www.showusyourshorts.com.au/)

if you want to include her art ... fill the letters with it. it doesn’t have to be the same every time it’s seen - the letterforms are consistent the fill is flexible yada yada

I’d suggest finding something other than Helvetica ... just cause I think it’s a cop out. But there’s nothing wrong with that.

a little research shows Shani is a deaf artist ... that’s a pretty distinct point of difference. while everyone’s experience of the world are different hers is going to be totally different from the ’norm’ - presuming it’s the right Shani Marchant

thanks re:ideas

—————  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Designer](http://web.archive.org/web/20090515134650/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)  
 [Short Film Festival](http://web.archive.org/web/20090515134650/http:/www.showusyourshorts.com.au/)

love it when things like this work out... as a concept at least ... the execution could be any number of ways.  
(hope you don’t mind)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090515134650im_/http:/typophile.com/files/shanimarchant_6395.gif)

—————  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Designer](http://web.archive.org/web/20090515134650/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)  
 [Short Film Festival](http://web.archive.org/web/20090515134650/http:/www.showusyourshorts.com.au/)

epsil: ... inspired by a font? but yes on reflection I guess the grey and font are similar to software thingy (how’s that going btw?) ... it’s also got a bit to do with how the last font in Illy stays the font for next click etc.

I don’t think Trade Gothic is the way to go either ... but it worked for illustration purposes.

—————  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Designer](http://web.archive.org/web/20090515134650/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)  
 [Short Film Festival](http://web.archive.org/web/20090515134650/http:/www.showusyourshorts.com.au/)

\> inspired by a font?

That and the idea of building a secondary word out of letters of primary text. That’s not to say it’s a rocket science of the logo design :-)

\> how’s that going btw?

On hold at the moment. Needs to sleep on it for a little bit more.

Go go go... grow grow grow...  
First attempt: empty...  
Second one: better:  
Third one: hope even better...  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
_Robert Koritnik_

Rob’s been drinking again. He always gets “poetic” when he’s been drinking.

—————  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Designer](http://web.archive.org/web/20090515134650/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)  
 [Short Film Festival](http://web.archive.org/web/20090515134650/http:/www.showusyourshorts.com.au/)
“I’ll have what he had” (pointing at a passed out guy on the bar floor)

ok. but you know that’s Rob over ... there? \*points at dude hanging from chandelier\*

—————  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Designer](http://web.archive.org/web/20090515134650/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)  
 [Short Film Festival](http://web.archive.org/web/20090515134650/http:/www.showusyourshorts.com.au/)
